DOC.brief_summary: Anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidant agents have become the important ingredients in sunscreen. However, there is no histologic study about the effects of anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidative properties of sunscreen to prevent premature aging from UVA and UVB.
DOC.brief_title: Histologic Response to UVA and UVB Exposure During the Use of Sunscreen
DOC.detailed_description: Premature aging can be prevented by using sunscreen. Currently, anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidant agents have become the important ingredients in sunscreen. However, there is no histologic study about the effects of anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidative properties of sunscreen to prevent premature aging from UVA and UVB.
DOC.criteria: subjects aged 3565 years who were scheduled for abdominoplasty the excised area should be larger than 18x10 cm2 no skin diseases or lesions on the excised area no topical treatment on excised area more than 1 month prior to this study pregnancy lactation have tattoo or striae distensae on abdomen
